page.title: 09FARMING IN LITTLEDALE
page.content: The land around Caton and Brookhouse is farmland and farming is the major industry in the area.There are 17 farms in all in our block,ranging in size from 70 to 240 acres.As the land is hilly, it is not suitable for crops and the vast majority of the farmland is grazing or meadowland.Most of these farms are run by the farmer alone,but the highest number working on any farm is 3.The busiest time of the year is haytiming when relatives and friends are called in to help out.Each farm has different machinery but all farms have at least one tractor.The largest farm,Pott Yeats,has 3 tractors,till drill, muck spreader,slurry spreader, mower, helipede and numerous trailers. All the farms keep sheep and cattle, both dairy and beef.Many of the farmhouses are very old,the oldest, Annas Ghyll,dating from 1664.
